meanings.definition: The starchy tuberous root of a tropical tree, used as a staple food in tropical countries.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, people rely on casavas for their daily meals.
meanings.sent2: Farmers harvest casavas to feed their families and communities.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly used casavas instead of potatoes in the stew.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as comforting as a warm bowl of casavas on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The market was filled with the earthy scent of fresh casavas.

meanings.definition: The plant that produces casavas, also known as manioc or yuca.
meanings.sent1: The casavas plant requires specific growing conditions to thrive.
meanings.sent2: In the garden, the casavas plant stood tall among the other crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel dug up the casavas plant looking for treats.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong and resilient as a mature casavas plant.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the casavas plant rustled in the gentle breeze.
